intro: Manglietia oblonga, commonly known as the Chinese evergreen, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Magnoliaceae family and is characterized by its large, evergreen leaves and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows as an understory tree in tropical rainforests, reaching heights of up to 15 meters. Its flowers are usually pink or white and bloom in the spring, attracting various pollinators. Due to its ornamental value and rarity, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
